duties_responsibilities.duty: Provide subject matter expert level procedural and technical support operations at Power Generation Divisions control centers and power plants.
Maintain cyber & physical access to meet corporate standards and/or NERC CIP standards.
Perform duties related to asset management including but not limited to inventory of systems.
Execute weekly, monthly, quarterly & annual reviews & documentation based on corporate compliance standards and/or NERC CIP Regulations.
Work closely with Subject Matter Experts (SME) and vendors to complete project goals including audits, vulnerability assessments, and mitigations.
Support cyber security improvement and lifecycle projects.
Prepare documentation in support of audits and maintaining compliance of PGD Sites in the area of the Corporate and/or NERC CIP Regulations.
Provide full-time technical support to the operations and business unit personnel.
Perform system testing and documentation to critical systems during significant changes and/or upgrades.
Analyze and identify the root cause of - and implement comprehensive technical solutions to - complex application deficiencies and system issues.

Develop new (and improve existing) processes with the goal of increasing productivity, reducing risk of system failure, promoting efficiency in workflow, and meeting or exceeding the key operational performance targets.
Establish, document, and maintain procedures and guidelines related to the day-to-day operational support provided to the operations and business unit personnel.
Travel to power plants for onsite troubleshooting support.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's or Master's degree in Engineering, Information Technology, or a related field
